Survey_Page.Title: Informatics-related activities

Directive.span: Rate the relevance (or potential relevance) of each of the following activities to your work.

Survey_Page.Directive: Please rate each item carefully. You will only be asked additional questions about the activities that are relevant to you.

Question_Block.Name: activities
Question_Block.Sub_Stem: Manage the on-time completion of grant or project proposals
Find collaborators who have specific skills needed for a project team
Identify CTSI members whose work is similar to mine
Obtain counts of patients who meet proposed inclusion/exclusion criteria, broken down by race-ethnicity and gender
Identify and recruit patients who meet inclusion/exclusion criteria for IRB-approved studies
Analyze medical record data (including labs, notes, etc.) from your own organization or a partner institution
Analyze public data sets (such as census, NAMCS, etc.)
Analyze non-public health care data (such as claims, disease registries, etc.)
Collect, manage or analyze genomic data
Collect, manage or analyze imaging data
Collect, manage or analyze human biospecimens
Collect, manage or analyze other tests on human subjects
Conduct research with members of specific target communities (e.g. neighborhoods, regions, race-ethnicities, etc.)

Survey_Page.Title: Access to clinical data
Survey_Page.Directive: What relative value would each of following data types have in your research (either for cohort identification and recruitment or for secondary data analysis) if it were available in a research data repository from one or more of the four CTSI institutions (Cedars-Sinai, Harbor-UCLA, Charles Drew/Hubert Humphrey, and UCLA Medical Center)
